column4: is the problem that you want the other computer to get a ip etc  from dhcp on your computer? that way you have to configure a dhcp server on your computer..
yes. But do I not have to mention something about the interface on my computer in /ec/network/interfaces?

I have never setup a dhcp-server, but I dont think you do that in /etc/network/interfaces, that file is for your local cards. I think uoi have to look in to configuring a dhcp server, and that is done some where else..
ok. I'm getting there with it anyway, I think. Cheers for the pointers!
